Preživeo jutro, ali ga pojeo mrak: Bajern otpustio Nika Kovača
Šampion Nemačke i zvanično razrešio trenera funkcije, Hansi Flik šefuje na naredne dve utakmice

03 Nov 2019

Niko Kovač nije više trener Bajerna iz Minhena! Pod vinjetom ekskluzivno, urednik SportBilda i najobavešteniji čovek kada su u pitanju dešavanja u Minhenu Kristijan Falk objavio je prvi u Nemačkoj da je hrvatski trener sporazumno raskinuo ugovor sa Bavarcima, što je pola časa kasnije potvrio zvanično i šampion Nemačke na svojim stranicama.
To je ujedno i rezultat celodnevnih nagađanja oko budućnosti Kovača na klupi šampiona Nemačke, koja se naslućivala posle sramotnog poraza od Ajntrahta u Frankfurtu od 5:1 u subotu popodne. Iako se tokom dana pojavila informacija da će Hrvat preživeti na klupi i dobiti poverenje da još dve utakmice (Olimpijakos i Borusija iz Dortmunda) sačuva posao, preokret je usledio ove večeri, pa je Kovač postao bivši trener Bajerna.
Klupski šefovi Uli Henes, Karl Hajnc Rumenige i Hasan Salihamidžić sastali su se sa Kovačem večeras i precizirali detalje raskida."Igre našeg tima u proteklih nekoliko nedelja i rezultati pokazali su nam da nam je potrebna hitna reakcija. Uli, Hasan i ja smo održali ozbiljan razgovor s Nikom na bazi jučerašnjeg izdanja u Frankfurtu i rezultat svega je da Niko Kovač više nije trener Bajerna. Žao nam je zbog ovakvog ishoda. Želim da se zahvalim Kovaču u ime Bajerna na svemu što je uradio u proteklom periodu, posebno na duploj kruni", rekao je operativac Rumenige.
Bajern je istovremeno saopštio i da će doskorašnji pomoćnik Hansi Flik prevoditi tim na naredne dve utakmice sa Olimpijakosom i Borusijom iz Dortmunda.
Niko Kovač je mirno primio informaciju da nije više trener Bavaraca, a nezvanično sam je ponudio klubu raskid saradnje."Mislim da je ovo prava odluka kluba u ovom trenutku. Rezultati, ali i način na koji smo igrali poslednjih nedelja naterali su me na ovakav potez. Moj brat Robert i ja smo zahvalni Bajernu na proteklih godinu i po dana u kojima smo osvojili titulu, kup i Superkup Nemačke. Bilo je to lepo vreme, a klubu želim sve najbolje", poručio je Kovač.
Hrvat je napustio Minhen posle 490 dana u kojima je na 65 utakmica zabeležio 45 pobeda i osvojio tri trofeja. Da li je mogao više, pokazaće vreme...

Survived the morning but was eaten by darkness: Bayern fired Nick Kovac
Champion of Germany and officially dismissed coach of the function, Hansi Flik bosses for the next two games

03 Nov 2019

Nobody is blacksmith Coach Bayern Munich anymore! Under the vignette exclusively, SportBild editor and most informed man when it comes to Munich events Christian Falk announced the first in Germany that a Croatian coach had mutually terminated his contract with the Bavarians, which was officially confirmed by the German champion on his site half an hour later.
It was also the result of all-day speculation about the future of Blacksmiths on the German champions' bench, which was felt after the infamous 5-1 defeat to Eintracht in Frankfurt on Saturday afternoon. Although information emerged throughout the day that the Croat would survive on the bench and be trusted to keep two more games (Olympiacos and Borussia Dortmund), a turnaround ensued this evening, with Kovac becoming a former Bayern coach.
Club bosses Uli Henes, Karl Heinz Rumenige and Hasan Salihamidzic met with Kovacs tonight and specified the details of the breakup. "Our team's games over the past few weeks and the results have shown us that we need an immediate reaction. interview with Nick on the basis of yesterday's edition in Frankfurt and the result is that Niko Kovac is no longer Coach of Bayern. We regret this outcome. I want to thank Kovac on behalf of Bayern for everything he has done in the past, especially the double crown " , said the Rumenige operative.
Bayern also announced that former assistant Hansi Flik will translate the team for the next two games with Olympiakos and Borussia Dortmund.
Niko Kovac calmly received the information that he was no longer a coach of the Bavarians, and I unofficially offered the club a termination of cooperation. "I think this is the right decision of the club at the moment. "My brother Robert and I are grateful to Bayern for the past year and a half in which we won the German title, cup and Super Cup. It was a good time, and I wish the club all the best," Kovac said.
The Croat left Munich after 490 days in which he recorded 45 victories in 65 games and won three trophies. Could he have done more, time will tell ...
